review_blob:
A mostly diminishing thin frothy white head tops up a hazy medium orange body. No lacing. No particles. No bubbles. Heavy filtration. Aroma presents malt being light cereal/bready and very light caramel while hops are very faint leafy ... Yeast character is light fruitiness. Also, there are evident evocations of Initial flavor is moderate sweet malt shell while development os lightly woody. Finish is medium . medium body... watery texture... Soft carbonation... Nice and honest beer, no flaws but has a main stream character to it.

Initial flavor is lighty acidic while development presents some raspberries and some metallic impressions. Finish is medium . medium body... watery texture... Lively carbonation...

A mostly diminishing large creamy tan head tops up a clear medium amber body. Moderate lacing. No particles. No bubbles. Initial flavor is moderate sweet while development adds up notes of .. fruity impressions.. Finish is medium . medium body... watery texture... Soft carbonation... Overall, its an impressive lager! I need to get more infos about the so-called vienna style..

review_blob:
Tasted along with the Gold Futsu and the Sanka Junmai. My favorite overall. Very clean taste. Warm alcohol from which you can feel the rice source. Flowery and nutty notes. Full body. Very pleasant.
[Sampled at salon des vins, Montral 2006, slightly cold ~10C]

Tasted along with the Gold Futsu and the Karakuchi Junmai. This one presents a bready character to the nose, more than the regular (or basic) Gold. Taste is sharper and more straight forward, while the body is cleaner than the regular Gold.
[Sampled at salon des vins, Montral 2006, slightly cold ~10C]
beer_name: Masumi Karakuchi Junmai Ginjo Ki-Ippon Sake

review_blob:
unfortunately, I dont know much about sake, but I do appreciate them. I had the opportunity to try this one side to side with the Sanka Junmai and the Karakuchi Junmai Ki-Ippon. Overall, this one was the least exciting. The taste showed linear rice impression although the finish offered a smooth and warming alcohol. The texture was thinner compared to the other two. 
[Sampled at salon des vins, Montral 2006, slightly cold ~10C]

review_blob:
A mostly lasting average frothy tan head tops up a very dark brown body. Moderate lacing. No particles. No bubbles. Aroma presents malt being moderate chocolate (the 90% cacao type) while hops are barely noticeable ... Yeast character is moderate fruitiness. Also, there are evident evocations of cherry , making the overall impression of a black forest cake. Some nuts overtones. Initial flavor is moderate sweet while development is a little more alcoholic. Finish is long . medium to full body... creamy texture... Soft carbonation...
Body has deteriorated a little over time, but its still very nice.

[Bottled ; about 7 years old.] 
This is a very rare bottle generously shared by cathschlag
